title: Methods and Trends in Detecting Generated Images: A Comprehensive Review
author: Arpan Mahara (Knight Foundation School of Computing and Information Sciences, Florida International University), Naphtali Rishe (Knight Foundation School of Computing and Information Sciences, Florida International University), ...
relevance_why: The techniques for detecting synthetic images could be adapted for applications like audio-image alignment and other cross-modal generative tasks in Haohe Liu's research.
background: Detecting artificially generated images from various advanced generative models to mitigate risks associated with misinformation and societal harm.
contribution: This paper introduces a comprehensive review of detection methodologies for AI-generated images, categorizing them and summarizing their advancements and limitations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous reviews mainly focused on deepfake detection without thoroughly covering recent synthetic image detection methods or multimodal platforms.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically analyzes and categorizes new detection techniques beyond deepfakes, including multimodal approaches for cross-analysis.

key_innovation: The survey not only reviews existing methodologies but also identifies commonalities among approaches and categorizes them into meaningful groups, providing references for future research.
real_world_impact: As AI-generated content becomes ubiquitous, understanding and developing effective detection methods will contribute to enhancing data authenticity and security in various industries.
limitations: The survey lacks empirical evaluation of specific methodologies, focusing instead on the categorization and theoretical insights.

new_terms.Generative Adversarial Networks: **Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)** are a class of machine learning frameworks in which two neural networks, a generator and a discriminator, contest with each other to improve the quality of synthetic data generation.
new_terms.Diffusion Models: **Diffusion Models** are a type of generative model that progressively transforms Gaussian noise into structured data, often achieving high-quality results in various tasks including image generation.
